comments.content:
People express themselves in ways they are most comfortable in. English is your proficiency so you pick English, while mandarin for others.

I always type in English. But if the person decides to reply in mandarin, I respect that. Me typing English is exposing the person to an English environment. And hopefully one day, s/he will feel comfortable enough to reply in English as well.

I've had many friends who switched from mandarin to English later on. It's always fascinating to experience that.

first.content: True, I don't mind to type in Chinese but English seems to be a easier way to introduce myself
